item.title: 12 Indians Fighting For Russian Army In Ukraine Killed, 16 Missing: Centre - NDTV
item.description:
12 Indians Fighting For Russian Army In Ukraine Killed, 16 Missing: Centre

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: Ministry of External Affairs

New Delhi: Twelve Indian nationals, among a total of 126, who were misled into settling in Russia have died fighting for the Russian Army in Ukraine, and sixteen others are currently missing.

  • Ministry of External Affairs confirmed the deaths and the missing status of Indian nationals involved.
  • As of now, 96 out of 126 Indian nationals have returned to India after being discharged from the Russian forces.
  • 18 remain in combat, with 16 being classified as missing by Russian authorities.
  • Prime Minister Narendra Modi has previously raised concerns about the safety of Indian nationals in discussions with Putin.
“So far, 12 Indian nationals have died in combat,” - Randhir Jaiswal, Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson.

This situation highlights the ongoing concerns regarding Indian nationals involved in foreign conflicts and the government's efforts to ensure their safety.

item.title: Team India for ICC Champions Trophy to be picked in Mumbai on Saturday - The Times of India
item.description:
Team India for ICC Champions Trophy to be picked in Mumbai on Saturday

Date: This Saturday, Source: Times of India

MUMBAI: The Indian team for the 2025 ICC Champions Trophy in Dubai and Pakistan, starting February 19, will be announced in Mumbai. Chief selector Ajit Agarkar will hold a press conference after revealing the 15-man squad for the tournament.

  • Jasprit Bumrah is unlikely to be part of the squad due to a back injury.
  • India's campaign begins against Bangladesh on Feb 20.
  • Rohit Sharma is expected to continue as captain despite recent poor form.
  • Karun Nair's impressive performances in domestic cricket raises questions about his selection.
“Whom do you drop if you have to pick Kaun in the 15? You can't drop someone like Shreyas Iyer, who smashed a century in the 2023 ODI World Cup semifinal.”

This weekend's squad announcement will be closely watched as it sets the stage for India's participation in the upcoming tournament.

item.title: 16 Indians Fighting In Russian Army 'Missing', 12 Killed So Far In Ukraine War: MEA - News18
item.description:
16 Indians Missing, 12 Reported Dead in Ukraine Conflict: MEA Updates

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: News18

At least 16 Indian nationals deployed by the Russian Army in Ukraine are currently missing, with 12 confirmed dead, as reported by the Ministry of External Affairs.

  • There are 126 Indian nationals known to have served in the Russian Army.
  • 96 of these have returned to India, with 18 still in service.
  • 16 are categorized as missing by Russian authorities, while 12 have died in the conflict.
“As of today, there have been 126 cases (of Indian nationals serving in the Russian Army). Of these 126 cases, 96 people have returned to India and have been discharged from the Russian Armed Forces.” - MEA spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal

The Indian embassy is working with Russian authorities to facilitate the repatriation of the deceased's remains and to assist those who are still serving.

item.title: NASA Hubble's most detailed image reveals Andromeda galaxy's hidden history - Moneycontrol
item.description:
NASA Hubble's Most Detailed Image Reveals Andromeda Galaxy's Hidden History

Date: January 17, 2025 / 17:41 IST

Source: Moneycontrol

The Andromeda galaxy, the closest large galaxy to Earth, has intrigued astronomers for over a century. A new study by NASA's Hubble Space Telescope reveals stunning details about this cosmic neighbour, shedding light on its complex evolution and differences from the Milky Way.

  • Hubble's imaging uncovered over 200 million stars in Andromeda, marking the most detailed survey of the galaxy.
  • The galaxy is located 2.5 million light-years away from Earth.
  • Hubble’s data spans the entire disk of Andromeda, offering a clear view of its stellar population.
  • The telescope can study stars brighter than our Sun.

This is the largest photomosaic ever made by the Hubble Space Telescope, showing Andromeda almost edge-on, tilted by 77 degrees relative to Earth’s view. (Image: NASA)

This is the largest photomosaic ever made by the Hubble Space Telescope.

In conclusion, the new findings from Hubble provide valuable insights into the structure and evolution of the Andromeda galaxy, enhancing our understanding of its differences from the Milky Way and its complex history.

item.title: BJP releases manifesto for Delhi polls, promises Rs 21,000 for pregnant women, LPG cylinders for Rs 500 - The Indian Express
item.description:
BJP releases manifesto: Rs 2,500 for women, more pension for senior citizens, meals for Rs 5

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Indian Express

Aimed at laying the foundation of development in Delhi, BJP's J P Nadda announced a manifesto featuring key welfare schemes including monthly payouts for women and increased pensions for senior citizens.

  • Monthly payout of Rs 2,500 for eligible women under the Mahila Samridhi Yojana.
  • Increased pension for senior citizens from Rs 2,000 to Rs 2,500; and for those above 70 from Rs 2,500 to Rs 3,000.
  • Nutritious meals for Rs 5 at ‘Atal canteens’ across slum clusters.
  • Commitment to eradicate corruption and improve existing welfare schemes.
  • Feedback collected from 1.8 lakh people prior to manifesto announcement.
“Modi’s guarantee means there is a guarantee that the guarantee will be fulfilled.” - J P Nadda

The BJP's manifesto highlights the party's focus on women's welfare, senior citizens' support, and poverty alleviation. The announcement has drawn criticism from AAP’s Arvind Kejriwal, who claims the BJP is mimicking his policies.

item.title: Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Live: Launches, unveils, and more from the event - news - The Financial Express
item.description:
Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 Live: New EV Launches

Date: 2025-01-12 Source: Financial Express

The Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 showcases the latest in electric vehicles with significant launches from major car manufacturers. Key highlights include the unveiling of the Hyundai Creta EV priced at Rs 17.99 lakh and the Maruti Suzuki eVitara.

  • Hyundai launched the Creta EV at Rs 17.99 lakh.
  • Maruti Suzuki unveiled the eVitara.
  • Tata Motors showcased new EV models including the Harrier EV and Sierra EV.
  • Two-wheeler launches included Hero's Xpulse 210 and Xtreme 250.
  • The expo features major brands like Maruti, Hyundai, Kia, and Tata.
“The Tata Avinya was a show-stopper at the expo.”

This expo highlights the growing electric vehicle market in India, with numerous companies unveiling their latest innovations.

item.title: Supermassive Black hole 700 million times mass of Sun spotted firing energy beam at earth - The Times of India
item.description:
Astronomers Discover Ancient Blazar Emitting Energy Beam Towards Earth

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Astrophysical Journal Letters

Astronomers have discovered the most ancient blazar ever observed, a supermassive black hole from the early universe that is shooting an energy beam directly at Earth.

  • The blazar has a mass equal to 700 million suns.
  • It is located approximately 12.9 billion light-years away from Earth.
  • The high-energy beam of radiation took almost 13 billion years to reach us.
  • This blazar is believed to have existed just 800 million years after the Big Bang, making it the most distant blazar recorded.
  • The discovery provides insights into the formation and evolution of supermassive black holes in the early universe.
“The alignment of J0410−0139's jet with our line of sight allows astronomers to peer directly into the heart of this cosmic powerhouse.” - Emmanuel Momjian, National Radio Astronomy Observatory

This remarkable discovery could indicate the presence of many more supermassive black holes from the same era, offering a significant opportunity for further exploration in astronomy.

item.title: Raveena Tandon’s daughter Rasha Thadani’s expressions steal the show, suggests early review of Azaad: ‘New Star born’ - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Raveena Tandon’s daughter Rasha Thadani’s expressions steal the show, suggests early review of Azaad: ‘New Star born’

Date: Jan 17, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

Rasha Thadani, daughter of Raveena Tandon, has impressed audiences with her debut performance in the film Azaad, according to early reviews.

  • Rasha has reportedly captivated the audience with her remarkable expressions.
  • She is being compared positively to other star kids, with some suggesting she should mentor others in acting.
  • High expectations surrounded her debut, which she appears to have met successfully.
  • In addition to acting, Rasha is recognized for her singing talent.
  • Netizens describe her as one of the most down-to-earth star kids in Bollywood.
“Sharmin Segal Mehta #HeeraMandi fame actress should take acting and expression classes from #RashaThadani Omg!!! Rasha expression are mind-boggling . She is the New Star born in the orange horizon ❤️#Bollywood #Newstar #UyiAmma.”

Rasha's future in the film industry looks promising following her successful debut.

item.title: Experts bat for early detection to prevent hepatitis deaths - The Hindu
item.description:
Experts Call for Early Detection to Reduce Hepatitis Deaths

Date: January 17, 2025

Source: The Hindu

A two-day summit in Chennai focused on eliminating hepatitis highlighted the crucial need for early detection to prevent deaths caused by this viral infection.

  • Speakers called for increased awareness and early detection methods during the Indian Hepatitis Summit 2025.
  • R.P. Shanmugam stated that 70% of hepatitis-related deaths are preventable.
  • Approximately 1.3 million people globally died from viral hepatitis in 2022, a rise from 1.1 million in 2019.
  • Rachel Holford termed hepatitis a “global crisis” and urged India to enhance its treatment efforts.
  • New app launched for data collection and follow-up efforts in managing hepatitis.
  • Online courses for 10,000 healthcare professionals also introduced to improve awareness and education.
“Early detection would help eliminate the disease.” - John Ward, Coalition for Global Hepatitis Elimination.

This summit aims to aid India in achieving the WHO’s goal of eliminating hepatitis by 2030, paving the way for significant improvements in public health outcomes.

item.title: Brazil says Meta hate speech policy changes do not fit with local law - Mint
item.description:
Brazil Concerned Over Meta's Changes to Hate Speech Policy

Publication Date: Tuesday, Date Unspecified
Source: Live Mint

Brazil's government expressed serious concern regarding Meta Platforms' new hate speech policy changes, arguing that they do not comply with local legislation.

  • The Brazilian government is asking Meta to explain its policy changes.
  • President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva has labeled the situation as “extremely serious.”
  • Meta has altered its approach towards discussions on immigration and gender identity.
  • Brazil is a significant market for Meta, with roughly 100 million active Facebook users.
  • The government believes that the changes could violate laws protecting the rights of citizens.
  • Meta stated that the changes are aimed at increasing freedom of expression.
  • A public hearing will be held to discuss these issues with experts.
"AGU and other ministries understand that the current terms of use, as well as the changes now informed by Meta, do not fit with Brazil's legislation and are not sufficient to protect fundamental rights."

This situation highlights the ongoing tensions between social media platforms and local laws regarding hate speech and freedom of expression.

item.title: Galaxy S25 to feature deeper Gemini integration, more AI features: Report - The Indian Express
item.description:
Galaxy S25 to feature deeper Gemini integration, more AI features: Report

Date: January 17, 2025 Source: Indian Express

Samsung is set to unveil the Galaxy S25 series on January 22, with significant new AI features powered by Google's Gemini.

  • The Galaxy S25 series will include deep integration with Google Gemini, enabling voice commands like 'Hey, Gemini'.
  • A new feature called “Now Brief” will personalize daily summaries for users.
  • The Galaxy S25 Plus will feature a camera setup including a 50MP primary camera, while the S25 Ultra will have four rear cameras, including a 200MP main shooter.
  • The S25 Ultra will also feature a 5,000mAh battery.
  • The expected price for the S25 Ultra is between Rs 1,20,000 and Rs 1,30,000.
“The Galaxy S25 Ultra is expected to launch somewhere between Rs 1,20,000 and Rs 1,30,000 with some bank offers bringing the price down.”

The Galaxy S25 series promises to enhance user experience through advanced AI integrations and impressive hardware updates.

item.title: Bharat Moblity | Auto Expo 2025 live updates: Maruti Suzuki e Vitara unveiled, Creta EV launch coming up - HT Auto
item.description:
Auto Expo 2025: Creta sold over 11 lakh units in India

Publication Date: January 17, 2025

Source: HT Auto

Hyundai is launching the Creta Electric, anticipated to boost sales of the widely popular Creta model in India.

  • The Creta EV offers two battery pack options - 51.4 kWh and 42 kWh, with ranges of 472 km and 390 km respectively.
  • It features three driving modes: Eco, Normal, and Sports.
  • Hyundai claims the Ev can accelerate from 0 to 100 km/h in 7.9 seconds.
“The sale of millions of vehicles shows how demand in India is consistently growing,” stated Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

The Auto Expo 2025 showcases the dynamic future of mobility in India, highlighting electric and innovative vehicles.

item.title: Alcaraz responds to Borges' burst, returns to Aussie Open fourth round - ATP Tour
item.description:
Carlos Alcaraz responds to Nuno Borges' burst, returns to Australian Open fourth round

Date: January 17, 2025 | Source: ATP Tour

Carlos Alcaraz continues his pursuit of a career Grand Slam at the Australian Open, advancing to the fourth round after defeating Nuno Borges in a four-set match.

  • Alcaraz dropped his first set of the tournament but won the match 6-2, 6-4, 6-7(3), 6-2.
  • He will face either Jack Draper or Aleksandar Vukic in the next round.
  • Alcaraz aims to be the youngest player to complete the career Grand Slam in men's singles history.
  • He has now reached the fourth round of the Australian Open for the second time in four appearances.
  • Alcaraz expressed joy at playing again on Rod Laver Arena, noting the crowd's support.
  • The match highlighted Alcaraz's strong serving and competitive spirit.
"I'm just happy to see a full crowd here watching my matches... I'm trying to play different tennis, some different kinds of shots." - Carlos Alcaraz

Alcaraz's performance continues to demonstrate his growth and potential as he targets a deeper run in the tournament.

item.title: Erling Haaland signs new nine-and-a-half-year Manchester City contract - The Athletic - The Athletic
item.description:
Erling Haaland signs new nine-and-a-half-year Manchester City contract

Publication Date: Not specified; Source: The Athletic

Erling Haaland has signed a lucrative new contract with Manchester City that will keep him at the club until 2034, solidifying his place as a cornerstone of the team.

  • Haaland extends his commitment to Manchester City for nine-and-a-half years.
  • The deal is among the most lucrative in sports history and removes any previous release clauses.
  • Haaland has scored 111 goals in 126 appearances since joining from Borussia Dortmund.
  • The contract ensures Haaland will likely surpass manager Pep Guardiola's tenure at the club.
  • The contract change may impact Haaland's pursuit of the all-time Premier League goalscoring record.
“It is his City now.” - Manchester City correspondent Sam Lee

This contract underlines Haaland's satisfaction in Manchester and his importance to the team's future.

item.title: Maruti Suzuki E Vitara launch at Auto Expo 2025: Expected price, interiors, range, features, specs, - The Economic Times
item.description:
Maruti Suzuki Launches e-Vitara Electric SUV at Auto Expo 2025

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Economic Times

Maruti Suzuki has unveiled its first electric SUV, the e-Vitara, at the Auto Expo 2025, highlighting plans for production and export across 100 countries.

  • The e-Vitara will have a range exceeding 500 kilometers on a full charge.
  • Price expected to be between Rs 20 lakh and 25 lakh.
  • It features a design similar to the eVX concept with modern aesthetics and dimensions.
  • Inside, it offers dual screens, Level 2 ADAS, and multiple premium features.
  • Battery options include 49 kWh and 61 kWh with different performance capabilities.
“Maruti Suzuki aims to leverage the lightweight battery design to deliver both efficiency and performance.”

This launch marks a significant step for Maruti Suzuki in the electric vehicle market, aiming to compete with existing electric SUVs in India.

item.title: US consulate opens in Bengaluru; Minister Jaishankar recalls efforts: ‘You get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
US Consulate Opens in Bengaluru, Heralding New Chapter in US-India Relations

Date: January 17, 2025, Source: Indian Express

After nearly two decades, the US Consulate in Bengaluru was inaugurated, significantly enhancing US-India relations, particularly in technology and innovation.

  • The consulate will initially not process visa applications but aims to do so soon.
  • Minister Jaishankar emphasized the consulate's importance for business and tourism.
  • Bengaluru is recognized as India's tech capital, pivotal for partnership in sectors like AI and space exploration.
  • The event was attended by various dignitaries, highlighting its significance for American companies in Karnataka.
“If you get Bengaluru done, I’ll get Los Angeles done.” - S. Jaishankar

The opening of the US Consulate in Bengaluru symbolizes strengthened bilateral ties and will provide benefits to American companies and Indian citizens seeking to travel to the US.

item.title: Who is Darrin Bell? Anti-Trump Pulitzer winning cartoonist arrested for possessing child pornography - The Times of India
item.description:
Who is Darrin Bell? Anti-Trump Pulitzer Winning Cartoonist Arrested

Publication Date: Not available
Source: Not available

Prominent cartoonist Darrin Bell, known for his anti-Trump work, has been arrested on charges of possessing child pornography.

  • Darrin Bell has received a Pulitzer Prize for his political cartoons.
  • The arrest has shocked many in the art and journalism communities.
  • Details around the charges and circumstances remain unclear as the case develops.
“This arrest is deeply troubling and contradicts the values of the creative community.”

The unfolding situation raises significant questions about accountability and public figures.
